name: Community Dining Program
description: A nutritious, well-balanced, Japanese-style hot lunch is provided 5 days a week, Monday through Friday (except major holidays) in a communal-tables setting. The menu is carefully planned and prepared by our Nutritionist and staff to ensure each meal is healthy, nutritionally balanced and adequately proportioned for seniors. Seating Information: 10:45AM-11:30AM RESERVATIONS: 10:45AM – 11:10AM WALK-INS: Available until all seats are filled or closing time: 11:30AM. Please wait in the walk-in line
fullDescription: A nutritious, well-balanced, Japanese-style hot lunch is provided 5 days a week, Monday through Friday (except major holidays) in a communal-tables setting. whatTheyOffer: A nutritious, well-balanced, Japanese-style hot lunch is provided 5 days a week, Monday through Friday (except major holidays) in a communal-tables setting. The menu is carefully planned and prepared by our Nutritionist and staff to ensure each meal is healthy, nutritionally balanced and adequately proportioned for seniors. Seating Information: 10:45AM-11:30AM RESERVATIONS: 10:45AM – 11:10AM WALK-INS: Available until all seats are filled or closing time: 11:30AM. Please wait in the walk-in line
howToGetIt: ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA Requires completion of the San Francisco citywide Intake Assessment, a nutrition assessment with Kimochi staffs, AND 1. Individual must be 60 years of age or older, or 2. Spouse or domestic partner of a senior enrolled in the program, or 3. An individual under the age of 60 with a disability who resides in housing facilities occupied primarily by older adults at which the Community Dining service is located, or 4. A disabled individual who resides at home with and accompanies a senior who participates in the program
cost: A voluntary contribution per meal is appreciated; voluntary contribution amount is set by the San Francisco Office on Aging guidelines and is subject to change.
requirements: 1) Individual 60 years of age or older and their spouse, regardless of age. 2) A handicapped non-elderly person who is a member of a household with an elderly person. 3) Successfully complete a nutrition assessment with staff.
keywords: congregate meals for seniors and people with disabilities
